formal_accuser.name: Jehennon veuve Thomas Diez Thomas
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: Named accused before execution; also mentioned Chrétien Jeandel declaration

accused.name: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
accused.origin: La Bourgonce in seigneurie of Etival

confession.seduction_context: Had lost a sheep; husband was angry and called her 'ribaude'. Man in black appeared as she was feeding sheep in barn, promised to give her money so husband would no longer be angry with her.
powder_types: grey powder (to kill or cure at her will)
sabbat_activities: twice carried up with master to direct the clouds

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband rented cherry tree from late Gros Didier and found servant of accused taking branches; Didier obtained satisfaction with payment of 1 franc
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle ravroit bien tost ledit Bessat

witnesses.name: Marie femme Remy Val de Liepvre

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused wanted witness and husband to harvest for her; they refused because already committed elsewhere
testimony.threat_quote: que tous les diables soient dedans les ouvriers et ouvrieres dudit Mazelay

harms_alleged.target: Marie femme Remy Val de Liepvre (self)

witnesses.name: Helleny femme de Damien le Menestrel
Jehennon femme Jean Didier Vagnier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Mother of girl who worked for accused

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after working 5 days in accused's house

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley and Jehennon wife of Thomas Didier Thomas

testimony.quarrel_subject: Daughter came asking for milk for Sunday dinner with midwife; he refused saying had no cows in milk

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: on the Sunday at the very hour for which she had requested milk

testimony.quarrel_subject: Witness drove off wolf attacking accused's son; told accused he was astonished wolf attacked child rather than animals; she said it was a witch not a wolf
Husband refused to sell them a cow on credit

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after she had taken it to pasture

testimony.quarrel_subject: Promised to harvest but made excuses for being unable to work on specific day
testimony.threat_quote: que tous les diables soient dedans les ouvriers et ouvrieres dudit Mazelay

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after curse; goat died previous Sunday

witnesses.name: Jehennon fille Jean Vagnier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Sister of girl who worked for accused

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after working in their house 2 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Warned her not to allow animals to stray in his field or he would have her fined

witnesses.name: Nicolas fils Thomas Jean Thomas de la Voeuvre
Catherine fille feu Michiel Petit Michiel
Estiennette fille Jean Holbin de la Pescherie
Demenge fils Jean Colas Holbin de la Pescherie
Mengeon fils Dieudonné Jean Demenge de la Pescherie
Jehennon femme Didier de Bedecourt
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Spun in accused's house in evenings

witnesses.name: Colatte femme Colas Holbin Valdeliepvre
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Contracted to work for accused's husband

testimony.quarrel_subject: She and husband contracted to work for accused's husband then went to work for another at La Pescherie
testimony.threat_quote: que jamais bled ne puisse elle coupper davantage

witnesses.name: Nicolas Robinet bourgeois de St Dié
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Accompanied prévôt at execution of Jehennon

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had to leave before harvest completed; also quarrel over harvesting shared nuts

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: some days after eating napueaux from accused's husband

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: Procureur for canons of St Dié asks for taking of evidence, following accusation by Jehennon veuve Thomas Diez Thomas (already executed) and declaration by Chrétien Jeandel

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: First interrogation of accused; denied all charges; her son Colas produced and testified about sabbat

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: Procureur asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; withstood thumbscrews but confessed when racked

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions, declared willingness to die; discharged Claudel Aulbert

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: Again confirmed confessions but discharged Damien of Mazelay and Colatte veuve Remy Valdelievre

timeline.subject: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

torture.requesting_official: Procureur for canons of St Dié

accomplices_named.name: Colatte veuve Remy Valdelievre
accomplices_named.context: Initially named as seen at sabbat, later discharged claiming hearsay from son

accomplices_named.name: Claudel Aulbert alias l'Allemant
accomplices_named.context: Initially named as seen at sabbat, later discharged claiming son told her

accomplices_named.name: Damien living at Mazelay
accomplices_named.context: Initially said played bombarde at sabbat, later discharged claiming hearsay from son

accomplices_named.name: Claudatte femme Demenge le Maire
accomplices_named.context: In prison on suspicion of witchcraft; accused said husband suspected her of being wolf that attacked son

prior_accusations.context: Named Dieudonnée at execution; maintained charge firmly when attached to stake

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ravroit bien tost ledit Bessat
notable_quotes.english: that she would soon have Bessat back
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Adam Bessat after cherry tree dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
notable_quotes.french: que tous les diables soient dedans les ouvriers et ouvrieres dudit Mazelay
notable_quotes.english: that all the devils be among the workers of Mazelay
notable_quotes.context: Curse when workers refused to harvest for her

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
notable_quotes.french: elle diroit son faict, sans se faire destirer de question, adjoustant qu'elle estoit femme de bien, et que sa tante Jehennon du Mesnil ban d'Estival avoit confessé son cas amyablement et sans entrer en prison, et qu'elle en feroit le mesme
notable_quotes.english: she would tell her story without being stretched in torture, adding that she was a good woman, and that her aunt Jehennon du Mesnil ban d'Estival had confessed her case amicably and without entering prison, and that she would do the same
notable_quotes.context: Witness 3 heard this on Shrove Sunday before arrest

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguitte (daughter of witness 4)
notable_quotes.french: Mere, mere, venez moy secourir, ma tante Dieudonnée est allentour de mon lict qui me veult faire mourir
notable_quotes.english: Mother, mother, come help me, aunt Dieudonnée is around my bed who wants to make me die

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolle (daughter of accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit veu la noire beste en leur noire chambre, et qu'il y en avoit des grosses et des petites, des laides et des belles, et que les plus belles faisoient la cuisine, et estoient tousjours devant
notable_quotes.english: that she had seen the black beast in their dark chamber, and that there were big ones and little ones, ugly ones and beautiful ones, and that the most beautiful ones did the cooking and were always in front
notable_quotes.context: Daughter's testimony about seeing black beasts in their house

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas (son of accused)
notable_quotes.french: voicy a l'entour de moy des rouges qui me pensent tuer, je crois que le diable est icy qui me les jecte avec ses cornes, pour tascher de m'offenser
notable_quotes.english: here around me are red ones who think to kill me, I believe the devil is here who throws them at me with his horns, trying to harm me

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit des gens en chex eulx qui mettoyent de l'argent dans une escuelle couverte d'ung tranchoir, et que vers la minuit elles le portoient hors de leur losgis, et qu'alors il y avoit quelque chose qui venoit prendre ledit argent, sans nommer l'espece, ny qui le venoit prendre
notable_quotes.english: that she had people in their house who put money in a bowl covered with a trencher, and that toward midnight they carried it out of their lodging, and that then there was something that came to take the money, without naming the species, nor who came to take it
notable_quotes.context: Strange story told to group of women at Mazelay

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Colas Holbin Valdeliepvre
notable_quotes.french: que jamais bled ne puisse elle coupper davantage
notable_quotes.english: that she may never be able to cut grain again
notable_quotes.context: Curse when witness went to work for another

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte femme Colas Holbin Valdeliepvre to Dieudonnée
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle en tireroit la raison, luy deust il couster son bien
notable_quotes.english: that she would get justice for it, even if it cost her property
notable_quotes.context: Witness's direct confrontation with accused about illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
notable_quotes.french: qu'il falloit laisser parler les meschants gens, ou les laisser pour le diable
notable_quotes.english: that one must let wicked people talk, or leave them to the devil
notable_quotes.context: Response to witness's accusation about causing illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'a esté par ces chemins là
notable_quotes.english: that she has not been on those roads
notable_quotes.context: Denial of attending sabbat during first interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Late wife of Claudel Aubert
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y avoit bien des sorcieres par la allentour, et qu'elle en feroit brusler, mais ne nomma personne
notable_quotes.english: that there were many witches around there, and that she would have them burned, but named no one
notable_quotes.context: General denunciation of witches in the area

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over economic resources: cherry tree theft, refusing to sell cow on credit, disputes over harvest labor, refusal to provide milk. Accused and husband appear to be labourers with animals and fields. Payment of 1 franc mentioned in cherry tree dispute. Several witnesses mention contracted harvest labor and disputes when workers went elsewhere.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange illness for 3 weeks, unable to walk without sticks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband rented cherry tree and found servant of accused taking branches; Didier obtained satisfaction with payment of 1 franc
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in napueaux (turnips) - gave illness and cured it

harms_catalog.victim_name: Marie femme Remy Val de Liepvre
harms_catalog.harm_description: Strangely ill, losing use of limbs. Bedridden for full year, still not fully recovered
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to harvest for accused because already committed elsewhere

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became terrified, toute frenetique et hors d'esprit
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: None mentioned - girl had worked in accused's house for 5 days

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Dieudonnée femme Toussaint Jalley and Jehennon wife of Thomas Didier Thomas

harms_catalog.harm_description: Another cow fell ill, then recovered after accused handled it

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow and calf belonging to Claudon Gerard Jalley
harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow miscarried so both she and calf had to be killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Daughter came asking for milk for Sunday; he refused saying had no cows in milk
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: on the Sunday at the very hour for which she had requested milk

harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow belonging to accused's husband cut open stomach of horse with its horn, animal died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness drove off wolf attacking accused's son; told her he was astonished wolf attacked child rather than animals

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Claudatte femme Claudel Aubert
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband refused to sell them a cow on credit

harms_catalog.victim_name: bull belonging to Claudatte femme Claudel Aubert
harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost a bull which she had taken to pasture for them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: After she had taken bull to pasture

harms_catalog.victim_name: several animals including goat belonging to Remy Valdeliepvre
harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost several animals including a goat previous Sunday
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Promised to harvest but made excuses; she cursed
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after curse; goat died previous Sunday

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill with frenetique condition, saw accused before her, sometimes running after her
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to eat soup in accused's house because frightened of reputation

harms_catalog.harm_description: Heifer died suddenly in the field
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Warned her not to allow animals to stray in his field or he would have her fined; she muttered something he could not hear

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill, in bed for 9 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She and husband contracted to work for accused's husband then went to work for another at La Pescherie

harms_catalog.harm_description: Promptly fell ill, did not recover until fortnight before Christmas
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had to leave harvest before completed
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: some days after eating napueaux from accused's husband

harms_catalog.victim_name: pig belonging to Nicolas Jalley de St Dié
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over harvesting shared nuts - she was angry when he said he would just harvest his own

harms_catalog.victim_name: bull, two foals, and a hen belonging to accused
harms_catalog.harm_description: Tried out powders on own animals
Ill with smallpox, lost use of arms
harms_catalog.method_alleged: red powder to harm, then white powder to cure

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Angry because he had enclosed a meadow to prevent their animals getting in

emotional_state_notes: No indication of defiance or extreme emotion during initial interrogation
Declared willingness to die after confession

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Claimed her husband had found Claudon Gerard Jalley taking 'une bolle' in one of his fields - witness denied this

third_parties.context: Son who testified about sabbat; Dieudonnée said she gave him to devil as servant 18 months before

third_parties.name: Nicolas (son of accused)
third_parties.context: Multiple witnesses report his stories about black man, devil, attacks; visible only to him, sister Nicolle, and mother; given to devil as servant

third_parties.name: Toussaint Jalley (husband)

third_parties.name: Percin (devil name)
third_parties.context: Name given in son's testimony; pinched son on forehead, gave silver coin that turned to stone

third_parties.name: Mre Navel
third_parties.context: Devil name in confession; man in black who seduced her 3 years earlier

third_parties.name: Jehennon du Mesnil ban d'Estival
third_parties.context: Aunt who had confessed amicably without entering prison

third_parties.name: Demenge Holbin
third_parties.context: Asked Nicolas if devil was his master

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally rich trial record with 27 witnesses providing detailed testimony. Key features: (1) Multiple references to wolf transformation and animal attacks - accused's own son was bitten by wolf leaving 7 holes in thigh, wolves appearing in village; (2) Healing practice clearly evident - accused cured Adam Bessat's illness with turnips, cured sick cow by touching it, cured Marguitte with apples; (3) Extensive testimony from accused's own children about diabolical visitations - son Nicolas and daughter Nicolle both describe black man/beasts visible only to them and mother; (4) Son Colas produced during trial and testified about attending sabbat with mother; (5) Confession obtained under torture (withstood thumbscrews, confessed on rack) includes detailed powder color system (black to kill, red to harm, white to cure, grey to kill or cure at will); (6) Accused confessed to harming own daughter with powder during smallpox; (7) Multiple labor disputes over harvest work - central theme of economic tension; (8) Change de Nancy consulted and approved both torture and death sentence; (9) Accused initially named accomplices but later retracted some names (Claudel Aulbert, Damien, Colatte veuve Remy Valdelievre) claiming hearsay from son; (10) Prior family history - aunt Jehennon du Mesnil confessed without entering prison; (11) Economic status assessed as middling based on: husband is laboureur, they own animals (cows, sheep, horses, hens), rent/own fields, employ servants, engage in harvest labor, but also face economic disputes and resource scarcity. The trial shows classic pattern of community tensions, economic disputes, and reputation building over years (oldest reputation 7 years) culminating in execution.
